title.narrative: OP 2.2: VIOLENCE

description.narrative: Child protection system with specific tools and expertise to identify, refer and address cases of violence, abuse and neglect, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 child protection system (legal framework, justice's system and institutions) strengthened to care, monitor and protect the rights of children affected by violence, abuse, exploitation and institutionalization, as well as children in conflict with the law.

participating-org.narrative: INSTITUTO NACIONAL DE LAS MUJERES M

sector.narrative: Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection system with specific tools and expertise to identify, refer and address cases of violence, abuse and neglect

description.narrative: The system for detecting and addressing situations of violence against children and adolescents and the response to the increase in violence during the COVID-19 lockdown were strengthened through training and virtual conferences. There were also campaigns aimed at helping families relieve stress during lockdown. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2021

Status of national guidelines, protocols or standard operating procedures (SOPs) for the health system's response to sexual violence against children (including adolescents), consistent with WHO guidelines and international human rights standards.

baseline.value: the system exist wiht insuficent human an financial resources

target.value: 2020:Country has a national multi sector plan created by law with with assigned human and financial resources

actual.value: 2020:The Country has a protocol for the health system's response to sexual violence against children
